title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Shadow Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the “frustration” that the Australian community has is “understandable” after the big four banks failed to pass on interest rate cuts to customers in full. The RBA cut the cash rate by 25 basis points to 0.75 per cent on Tuesday - the first time Australia has seen interest rates fall below 1 per cent. Mr Chalmers told Sky News “The behaviour of the banks in this instance has been indefensible” and that the prime minister is “hypocritical” for not passing on the interest rate cuts through the deeming system to Australian pensioners. “The Reserve bank has made it really clear that the banks are still incredibly profitable by international standards,” he said. Image: News Corp Australia
